definition: in the depth of one's soul
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: Deep within their souls, a memory was stirred. Something was touched and set in motion.
sentences.chinese: 他們靈魂深處的記憶甦醒了過來，似乎有所觸動。

sentences.english: Shu Ting's poems, always touch the depths of the human soul.
sentences.chinese: 舒婷的詩，總是觸動到人的靈魂深處。

sentences.english: In the depth of my soul there is a wordless song. -- Kahlil Gibran
sentences.chinese: 在我的靈魂深處有一首無詞的歌。

sentences.english: Do her eyes see your true heart, and touch your soul so deeply it hurts?
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛看見你真心，觸摸你靈魂深處的疼痛嗎？

sentences.english: Please listen carefully to my confession at the deepest of my soul.
sentences.chinese: 請你細心聆聽我靈魂深處的獨白。

sentences.english: to a privileged tour into the inner soul of America.
sentences.chinese: 進入美國的靈魂深處進行一次特許的旅遊。

sentences.english: ALso, lovers can easily touch each other's soul during their tour.
sentences.chinese: 戀人們到此一遊，也可以輕易觸摸到彼此的靈魂深處。

definition: variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to miss/to yearn day and night
to make a concession/to be accommodating
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
unswerving in one's loyalty (idiom); faithful and constant
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
